p: It is clear from Table 1 that water, ethanol, and methanol are considered as the most appropriate solvents for the extraction of phenolic constituents from walnut leaves. Also, some detailed studies available in the literature demonstrate the effectiveness of such solvents. In an evaluation, the anti-proliferative, cytotoxicity and antioxidant activity of walnut leaf extract using different solvents (water, methanol, ethanol, acetone, and benzene) revealed that the methanolic and aqueous extracts might be subjected to further experiments because they contain several secondary metabolites, mainly phenolic compounds [ 145].
